docs.snippet: The inexorable advance of esports will break new ground next month when the NBA becomes the first American professional sports organization to operate an esports league.

headline.print_headline: NBA Leaps on Esports Bandwagon With New League
headline.main: NBA Leaps on Esports Bandwagon With New League

docs.snippet: The suspected Austin bomber called himself a "psychopath" in a recorded confession and said he felt no remorse for deadly explosions that killed two people and terrorized the city, a U.S. congressman said Saturday.

headline.print_headline: Congressman: Bombing Suspect Called Himself a 'Psychopath'
headline.main: Congressman: Bombing Suspect Called Himself a 'Psychopath'

docs.snippet: Mikael Owunna met and photographed more than 50 L.G.B.T.Q. Africans in 10 countries across Europe and North America, and the resulting images exhibit the power that comes from insiders documenting their own community.

headline.print_headline: Pride and Self-Love in the L.G.B.T.Q. African Diaspora
headline.main: Pride and Self-Love in the L.G.B.T.Q. African Diaspora

docs.snippet: A 39-year-old motor parts billionaire and extreme sports enthusiast seeking to shake up Thai politics has been compared to France's Emmanuel Macron and Canada's Justin Trudeau for his youth.

headline.print_headline: Thai Politics-No Country for Young Men?
headline.main: Thai Politics-No Country for Young Men?

docs.snippet: After West Virginia, teachers in some other conservative states are protesting over pay and benefits, with a statewide strike looming in Oklahoma at the start of April.

headline.print_headline: Fed Up, Teachers in Oklahoma May Walk Next
headline.main: Their Pay Has Stood Still. Now Oklahoma Teachers Could Be the Next to Walk.

docs.snippet: While most of the of journalists who covered the Winter Olympics went home once the games ended, Chang Lee remained to cover the Paralympics, the games for athletes with impairments.

headline.print_headline: Looking at the Paralympics With a New York Times Photographer
headline.main: Looking at the Paralympics With a New York Times Photographer

docs.snippet: Following are five big themes likely to dominate thinking of investors and traders in the coming week and the Reuters stories related to them.

headline.print_headline: Take Five-World Markets Themes for the Week Ahead
headline.main: Take Five-World Markets Themes for the Week Ahead

docs.snippet: After a dozen years, Vanessa Haydon Trump says she is leaving the first family.

headline.print_headline: A Trump  Is Exiting  The Family
headline.main: Unbecoming a Trump: The Vanessa Trump Divorce

docs.snippet: UMBC's improbable run through the NCAA Tournament was brief. The statement the Retrievers made and their place in history is forever.

headline.print_headline: UMBC's NCAA Fairytale Ends but Memories Will Last Forever
headline.main: UMBC's NCAA Fairytale Ends but Memories Will Last Forever

docs.snippet: Sue and Don Lee had never worked in a restaurant, but, when their daughter asked them to move across the country and open a Korean food stand, they said yes.

headline.print_headline: A Mother’s Touch Infuses a Korean Food Stand
headline.main: At Ejen in Sunset Park, Brooklyn, a Mother’s Touch Infuses the Menu
